website_summaries.verdict: A simple dematting tool that can cut your grooming time.
pros: Rounded edges help protect your dog's skin from irritation
Works well going through both longer and shorter fur
Nice for pets with thick coats
Just gets the matted undercoat without pulling out the topcoat
Comes in three sizes to fit your dog
cons: This is not intended to be used for dogs with thin hair
You may find you will have to stop often to clean out the hair on this brush

customer_reviews.title: I can not recommend this brand enough
customer_reviews.text: I can not recommend this brand enough!!! I have a Great Pyrenees who has never let us brush her in her life, and whose lifestyle causes her to be severely matted until her quarterly grooming appointments. Well, I just used these brushes on her today, and not only did she let me brush her but they worked EXTREMELY WEL! (Maybe even a little too well, it removed almost all of her undercoat in January - oops!) but she is so comfortable now! I cannot see myself using another brand after this! Can not recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Scobie

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This brush/rake works amazingly on our husky! And it seems like he really enjoys the way it feels. Doesn’t pull up any topcoat really just gets all undercoat. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: brit

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This grooming tool really works wonders
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tool for removing thick hair from my GSD. Heidi is a German Shedder par excellance and all the slicker brushes I've used weren't really good, and seemed to irritate the dog more than anything else. This rake-style tool is unbelievably good. Doesn't irritate the dog at all, and removes unreal amount of hair quickly. Very easy to remove the hair from the teeth, too. My GSD actually looks thinner without all that undercoat hair, and not seeing as much loose hair around the house now. I think this is better than a Furmenator, and maybe a bit safer for the animal, too. My highest recommendation if you have a double-coated breed.
customer_reviews.author: GrayslakeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for long hair cats or dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly amazing and a game-changer! We have two pure bred Maine Coon cats. They are always used to us brushing them. So they acclimated well to the rake. Picture that I have attached was less than a minute of brushing through there heavy undercoat. Now that we do this regularly, their fur is so much softer and we are noticing less shedding around the house. Highly recommend this rake to anyone who owns a long-haired cat or dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rainmaker

customer_reviews.title: It gets rid of the spay coat FUZZ
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old golden retriever has developed 'spay coat', which for her means thick, weightless FLUFF. My breeder recommended this tool for me after I had tried almost everything else. IT WORKS!!! I love this little tool....and it's cheap!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MissyB

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have a miniature schnauzer/cairn terrier mix. She doesn't really shed but her coat looked blown and awful. I saw a video that suggested using an undercoat rake to clean out the dead hairs--an alternative to hand stripping a non-show dog. I purchased the 9-19 undercoat rake and took out nearly a half-pound of undercoat (yes, I weighed it on a kitchen scale!). That's a LOT considering she weighs just over 14 pounds. She looks much better and the process took minutes rather than the hours that hand stripping requires.
customer_reviews.author: Susan W.

customer_reviews.title: Very effective rake!
customer_reviews.text: The last dog I had was part Pyranees and I lived with white hair coating my entire world for the 15 blessed years he shared my life. I swore my next dog would not shed as much. So I got a black Labrador. You would think the shorter coat would not produce much extra hair, but I am here to tell you a Lab's coat is very deceptive. It turns out she sheds MORE than the Pyranees ever did!! This type of rake was recently recommended by a groomer. It does a better job of removing the undercoat than any other comb, brush or rake that we have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Libraryannie

customer_reviews.title: Best tool on the market, pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! When I first saw it I was skeptical but this really gets so much hair and does not pull or hurt. My labradoodle who was supposed to not be a shedding breed sheds an insane amount. I think more lab than poodle, but he hates all other brushes and shedding rakes we have tried. He is much easier to brush and tolerates this more than any of the others we have tried and this really gets the undercoat so very well! I use every few days and always have a huge pile of hair. It really beats just having the hair all over the place. His shedding was really driving me crazy and this has reduced it tremendously!
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: Extra Wide Easy to use and very efficient
customer_reviews.text: Using it on my Golden Retriever that it seems I wasn't fully aware of how heavy an undercoat she can grow over the cold season. This comb easily removes the undercoat and will produce mounds of fur you didn't know was driving your dog nuts with rubbing and scratching. Love the device. It just removes the undercoat easily and doesn't harm the outer coat in any way. I have another undercoat comb (Furminator) but nothing holds a candle to this comb for getting the undercoat out. The Furminator is headed to the trash. I recommend Paws Pamper Extra Wide Undercoat Rake for Golden's and they love to have you use the comb to remove the undercoat.....who knew?
customer_reviews.author: BIGMAC80

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: My dog groomer showed me this kind of tool, while I wish it was a little wider for the job I have (that is my fault in searching) this brush is fantastic! I have a large Bernese Mountain dog with hair, so so much hair, and even in one run there are more piles of hair than if I would brush him for 20 minutes with his normal rake and paddle brush. On a whim I tried it on the cat and he went nuts he loved it so much, and also the amount of hair that came off was incredible! Less hair around the house and happier, lighter pets. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nowak

customer_reviews.title: I love it and so does my dog
customer_reviews.text: No down side to this comb. I love it and so does my dog. I have spent a lot of money for bogus products but this one really works great! I have two Old English Sheep dogs and combing them now is possible. Great for everyday use and de- tangling. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald J. Croston

customer_reviews.title: This really works
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think this looked like much when I took it out of the package. The teeth just seemed too blunt and spaced too far apart. But when I tried it on the dog, I was quickly convinced that this is a great tool. First of all, my dog (Shiba Inu) loved it; she appreciated the much gentler stroke this tool requires as opposed to a Furminator. Second, this tool does a much better job at removing that thick undercoat, just as promised. I'm really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karyl Cooper

customer_reviews.title: JUST GET IT NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Sent from the heavens for us humans that live among dogs 🐕 this rake is GOD SEND! GET IT! This is by far the BEST tool I’ve used to remove the undercoat of my very frequent shedding full bled german Shepherd. Let me tell you, this makes the furminator look like a joke. I can take 20 times more hair with ease in a single stroke of this rake, it’s worth every penny. My only complaint is that I wish there was a wider size, other than that this is by far the best tool out there.
customer_reviews.author: Chris molina

customer_reviews.title: How did we get by so long without this?!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I am impressed. I have a golden retriever mix who has an average amount of hair...not extremely thick. In less than 15 minutes brushing with this "rake" device we had a very large pile of fur that came out so easily. I could have continued but decided to give my boy a break, although he did enjoy it. We will do a little every day for awhile. I was a skeptic before, but this brush is very effective. His hair looks more sleek and shiny than ever. So glad I got this!
customer_reviews.author: Finni-boy

customer_reviews.title: Great brush for all dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have two heavy shedders and are always looking for ways to keep their coats in good shape. Our groomer recommended this product and after using it only a few times, I can se why she did. It really does a great job. Not sure if it's just the nature of our dogs long hair, but it was a little harder to clean than other brushes and combs - but then again it did a much better job in less time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Botteri

customer_reviews.title: works really well!
customer_reviews.text: Have to admit I wasn't so sure about this given the simple and non-flattering commentary on the packaging - but this is a FANTASTIC tool. Used it for our gigantic newfy who has recent allergies, itching, and new and super complex matting. This tool took the equivalent of about a few medium sized dog's hair off of him and made him WAY more comfortable once we got the mats removed. He liked it, too! It's WAY more effective overall than the Furminator, and I thought THAT tool was pretty nifty!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Haupt

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: I have two pure-bred huskies. This works about as well as a furminator, and is much more gentle on their outer coat. My dogs hate being brushed, but I've been able to use this on them with a good deal more ease than I'm used to. I'm hoping that over the next few months with recurring positive experiences they'll come to enjoy being brushed with this. I would absolutely recommend this product to anyone with a double-coat breed. It feels very sturdy, has and needs no moving parts, and it's pretty gentle on the skin. I tried it on myself before I used it on the dogs to make sure it didn't scratch, and it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mehollin

customer_reviews.title: Gets the undercoat out and can you believe it but dogs actually like it!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Akita with a serious undercoat and she does not like being brushed. She squirms and wiggles in the whole process is just a pain in the butt. And then I found this brush. She really does seem to like it. She's trying to sit when she wants something and I was absolutely Blown Away win the second time I went to brush her she saw the brush and sat. This is huge progress for this dog and she's looking pretty darn good. The brush is easy to use and clean. I have no complaints about this brush at all. Finally my dog looks like a pet did not a homeless stray dog.
customer_reviews.author: A. Reed

customer_reviews.title: BEST UNDERCOAT BRUSH BY FAR
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepard and a Husky/Lab mix. I couldn’t believe how well this worked. I have bought the furminator (3rd place), miscellaneous brushes from amazon, and the king komb (2nd place). NOTHING works has good as this brush. I’m upset that I didn’t buy it sooner. My dogs even seem to like it more. It doesn’t shave or pull hairs, it’s grabs under coats really well. My husky/lab doesn’t have a think undercoat like the German Shepard and it still works great. I’m telling you, don’t bother with any other undercoat brushes. You still want a top coat brush to finish it off but this will get that endless hair off your dogs!
customer_reviews.author: THE AVG PRO

customer_reviews.title: It works and my dog likes it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a long haired German Shepherd that sheds non-stop, year round. It literally never stops. He was professionally groomed yesterday with the furminator, and less than 24 hours later I was still able to collect a bag full of hair. I got the 20-blade rake and it’s perfect for our 80lb dog boy. This is better than every grooming/de-shedding tool I have (and I have a lot), including the furminator. It picks up so much in one pass, it’s soothing to our pup, and it releases shed hair effortlessly — it pulls right off. Fingers crossed that regular brushing with this will keep me from non-stop sweeping. If you’re still looking for the ideal de-shedder, give this a try.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley F.

customer_reviews.title: Great brush
customer_reviews.text: This brush is the best I’ve ever used to remove fur from my dog, including undercoat. It works better than the furminater that I bought years ago. It doesn’t pull or make that noise that sounds like your pulling the fur out. The Airedales do not mind being brushed with this, I believe it has to do with the curved metal. It collects a good amount of fur before having to clean it, but I found that there was fine fur that floated off. With the Coronavirus and not being able to get our dogs groomed, this is a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Gadget!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is awesome! My daughter ‘s American Eskimo had some, “I have no hope!” matted fur. Koda usually screams when anyone tries to brush her; however, this undercoat comb didn’t cause her the normal anxiety and screams we are used to. It dematted her fur in no time. I highly recommend purchasing this amazing gadget if you have an animal with a thick undercoat!
customer_reviews.author: Bonblast

customer_reviews.title: Husky/Lab mix
customer_reviews.text: I have been fighting the hairy beast for years. 100+ lbs of shedding puppy dog. Hated for people to come over for all the fur balls running around, resigned to just living with it, love the dog. This brush is a life saver! Not finished yet, but have pulled a ton of hair from my buddy. Ok, not a ton. I can pet him without blowing or shaking hair from my hands. I usually don't write long reviews, but I'm really happy with this brush. Hope this helps someone else suffering with fur balls run amuck!
customer_reviews.author: steveb

customer_reviews.title: Good for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog (Australian Shepard) hates to be brush, and usually cries and runs away when we try. We got this and she at least allows us to use it on her. The only inconvenience we have is that it holds so little hair. After almost every stroke you have to stop and clean it. This might be we brought the wrong size for our hairy pet, but if I knew this I would have picked something different or at least a different size.
customer_reviews.author: michigan mother

customer_reviews.title: A very useful undercoat rake
customer_reviews.text: This undercoat rake is great! It helps get any matted spots on our dogs fur detangled. If you’re needing a product to help with detangling or dematting your dogs thick coat or long haired breed, then this is what you need. One word of caution, the blades are sharp so when you are cleaning the loosened fur from the blades be careful or you could nick your fingers. The curved blades help reduce the chances of nicking your pets skin during use of this.
customer_reviews.author: NC customer

customer_reviews.title: Best deshedding pet hair remover
customer_reviews.text: This rake is amazing. My shepherd/lab sheds like crazy. I have bought many brushes over the years, including the Furminator. Nothing works. I had almost given up. I read the reviews on this rake and figured I would give it a try. You cannot believe the amount of hair I removed. My dog loves it. She never enjoyed being brushed until now. She lies down and falls asleep. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CB57

customer_reviews.title: Dog hated it
customer_reviews.text: My dog hated this tool. I am dumbfounded at all the good reviews. My dog has no problem getting brushed, but he knows when his coat blows out, I'm all over him for days. I read the reviews and thought I'd try it. Mistake. This thing is terrible. It cuts good hair, the metal is rough. You have to push away all the hair in one spot at a time to get to it. Good luck getting through that. Do yourself a favor and look for a rake with a double row. Works much better and won't rip out or cut off your dogs hair.
customer_reviews.author: marigold13

customer_reviews.title: For the doggos!
customer_reviews.text: It works VERY VERY well. Dogs don't like it that much because it pulls, but it definitely pulls that undercoat off. It is great for German Shepherd Dogs. And wider/larger than some of the ones I have seen and the others I have. Only one issue is that the hair puffs into soft silky tufts and sticks to the dog, and it takes a slicker brush and horse hair brush to clean up the fur that sticks and to polish the GSD fur.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Getchell

customer_reviews.title: Loved by me, loved by my dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 20-blade version for our Alaskan husky, but I almost didn’t buy it because of the word “blade”. I thought it might be sharp or uncomfortable for our dog. It turns out she loves it. She’s never been enthusiastic about grooming before, but as soon as she sees this brush, she runs up and happily plops herself in front of me, just waiting to be groomed. And, as many other reviews describe, it works wonderfully well.
customer_reviews.author: OhHappyDay

customer_reviews.title: Husky german shepherd coat blowout
customer_reviews.text: It works great for the undercoat and my dog seems to not mind it. He hated the furminator brush we used before. The only issue is that because the teeth are wider, it doesn't always catch all of the fine hairs. He is currently blowing out his coat, and the brush will be done catching loose hairs but you will still see fur flying off him. It's a good deterrent brush, but you'd have to use it everyday during the blowout.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Pleasently surprised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this following a recommendation from our vet. We have two golden retrievers and were vacuuming twice a day. Now we vacuum twice a week. It works well (we use it daily) and the dogs like it more than the other dozen brushes we own. They actually stand still while being brushed with this. One negative: the handle is smallish in diameter and twists easily. Wish the handle were more ergonomic. I think I’ll wrap this one with friction tape...
customer_reviews.author: HowardK

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This exceeds my wildest expectations. I was hopeful but not overly so. We have used other grooming combs in the market for our huskies, one wooly coat and one plush. Though they technically worked it wasn't without yanking and pulling. This comb feels like it's not doing anything because it meets no resistance, but WOW. The undercoat cleans up amazing. I got more hair off of our dogs than ever before with no yips or painful pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Donna O.

customer_reviews.title: Best tool I have found yet for my long-haired GSD mix
customer_reviews.text: I have a long-haired 90lb shepherd mix. This extrawide undercoat rake is amazing. When I look at the huge pile of undercoat hair that I remove from my dog every few days, I realize that much hair will NOT be on my floors and clothes. My dog loves being brushed with this more than bristle brushes and combs. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Loh

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully on my long haired dog.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first rake/brush that works on all 3 of my dogs. One is long haired, one has short wiry hair, and the third's hair is in-between. My long-haired Irish Setter hates to be brushed, but she will allow me to work on her coat for at least 10 minutes without protesting when I use the rake. The rake has made working on her coat almost enjoyable. The other two dogs don't care one way or the other, so nothing to report about them except that it works well on them too..
customer_reviews.author: NatureLoverCD

customer_reviews.title: Best rake ever!
customer_reviews.text: We used the furminator deshedding tool for our vizsla yellow lab mix for years. We thought it did a great job. We recently got a wirehaired pointing griffon and purchased this rake for him. It works amazing on him. Removes so much of his undercoat. Then we tried it on our older dog. I instantly threw the furminator away! The handle was coming off anyway, so it was time. This brush has a solid wooden handle and fits perfectly in either paw (hand). It's a solid tool and I think it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: KRD

customer_reviews.title: Takes off a lot of hair, but my dogs hate this brush
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the proper length according to your chart, but I am 99% this tool hurts my dogs. They run away when I bring this tool out! That’s never happened with any brushes before. When I am able to use this on my dogs, so much hair comes off, almost like using a furminator brush except your better off purchasing that brush as this one will be very uncomfortable for your fur babies.
customer_reviews.author: Kaela

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item works better than styles with plastic handles. Demats so well each time we use it, it lasts many days longer than other dematting tools. Because it really gets rid of all mats quickly and easily. It definitely thins the cost though, which is fine with us but be careful about how thoroughly you use it. I'd only recommend it if you're okay with the dog's coat becoming thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use on my Siberian Husky. The tool barely removed her shedding undercoat. I could remove much more fur, more quickly by hand. I bought it because so many comments about how the dogs seemed to like it better than the Furminator. Of course the dog was fine with it, because it really didn't do anything. This did not work as advertised and to me, was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a shepherd mix. We have the furminator but the shedding was still requiring a twice a day vacuum. My dog also tolerated but clearly disliked the other brush. This one she was much better and it did a much better job without causing her distress. Her coat looks shinier and there’s definitely less loose hair. I’m glad I bought this one!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Great grooming tool!
customer_reviews.text: An Australian Shepherd with very thick and long hair is a member of our household. We have purchased various grooming tools in an attempt to reduce the amount of hair our dear, four-legged child sheds throughout our home. To date, this undercoat rake is the best tool we have . The amount of hair removed during a grooming session using this rake is remarkable. I would love to report that by using this tool regularly no long, black and white dog hairs are no longer seen on our floors or furniture, but the amount of hair is significantly reduced.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove undercoat for my Aussie-Doodle... who sheds like a pure Aussie. I think I removed a another dog! Works excellent! Bought the extra large with both wide tooth and finer tooth 13/27. Used mostly 13 side but 27 works better on less dense areas like belly. Expecting to see a lot less hair around house now that I’m weeding out his coat. And my dog didn’t mind the grooming session either. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Living the dream

customer_reviews.title: My poor husky should live in Alaska not in New Orleans
customer_reviews.text: I have a husky mix that leaves a week of hair everywhere he goes, seriously he looks like the cartoon character pig pen with a cloud of dust but instead of a cloud of dust it’s a cloud of hair. This brush really does get a lot of the undercoat and hair out that he sheds. People would come over and complement me on my white fur rug ..... no it’s the dogs hair I would say. Seriously the dog shed enough hair to make another dog every day. I sweep and swiffer the floors at least three times a day. But the little comb really does work and it helps him out and me
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Swaguespack

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my German Shepherd
customer_reviews.text: Great for plush coated double coated dogs. I have a plush go to German Shepherd and it works great on him just be careful don’t push too hard involve directions of taking short strokes. I have a plush go to German Shepherd and it works great on him just be careful you don’t push too hard as the blades are sharp. Follow the directions of taking short strokes
customer_reviews.author: Art T.

customer_reviews.title: very easy to use ****
customer_reviews.text: my dog hate being brush out she will run away on me ever time when she see me coming with the so called older dog brush-- she been very great with this PawsPamper Extra Wide Undercoat Rake she will let me brush her out -she a Icelandic sheep dog and her hair get knotted up very easy this really works great just wish i had it years ago--Ive try many different ones this one is the best!! and the cat even loves it !!
customer_reviews.author: Shalom

customer_reviews.title: This superseded my expectations!!!
customer_reviews.text: This superseded my expectations!!! First, I used regular dog brush on my 3 goldens until very little fur came out. Then, I used this brush and and was amazed at how much fur came out --- I'm talking handfuls more of the undercoat. It didn't do much when their fur was short, after grooming. Worked best on longer, bushier fur.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie R.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for hard to groom dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This grooming tool works amazing! We have struggled with my 15 yr old St Bernard mix extreme shedding. And with his aging and lack of motivation he moves less and less. Keeping his fur groomed has been a struggle. I used this the day it arrived. I removed 3 bags of hair from him on the first day without even getting to his haunches! It’s so gentle he barely moved! The tool is made well too so it’s going to last a long time. It’s well worth the price. I’m so glad I purchased this!!
customer_reviews.author: AmW

customer_reviews.title: This rake works very well on my Great Pyrenees (male) who has extremely thick and long hair ...
customer_reviews.text: This rake works very well on my Great Pyrenees (male) who has extremely thick and long hair which gets matted after only a few days of grooming. He does not appear to be uncomfortable as he is with the other brands. The handle is a bit hard (wood) and rake blades are too short which means that after 2 or 3 passes I have to remove the hair. As long as he is comfortable while I am grooming him I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: CE

customer_reviews.title: Great for a dog who resists being brushed
customer_reviews.text: One warning: this brush looks mean...it looks uncomfortable, almost painful. But, I tried it out anyway. Our dog resists getting brushed. I normally have to fight him to sit still and let me brush him. Luckily, looks are deceiving... our dog now rolls over and wants to be brushed. He loves this, even with his thick undercoat. He doesn't resist getting brushed at all. And, it works great, too. It removes the undercoat and the top coat easily. It's a great brush, glad I tried it out.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing is how I would describe undercoat rake. I have a long haired German Shepherd that has a very thick coat. It truly was amazing how quickly I was able to brush her out and the amount of hair that came out was crazy! She loved it . It was easy combing. I would highly recommend this to anyone with a long haired dog or cat, I also used it on my long haired cat.
customer_reviews.author: Terri R

customer_reviews.title: Great for any GSD
customer_reviews.text: So I was hesitant at first glance but indeed the blades are very dull but the angle magically pulls out shedded undercoat by the literal gob loads .. I have a GSD long hair and the coat has been driving my GSD nuts with constant scratching and itching ! After using this two days she is a new dog ! Fantastic product for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: TD Tourney

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for dogs that have undercoats and shed alot
customer_reviews.text: I have a flat coat retriever and he always seems to be poofing hair here in Texas because of the fact that it is always hot! He definitely needs to lighten his hot fur in the hot summer. My brother told me about this tool and I decided to give it a try. I removed so much hair! I use the furminator pretty regularly, but this tool gets the fluffy undercoat better and more completely than the furminator does. I could not get over how much better it did! We got the Extra wide undercoat rake for our flat coat.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Helpful...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Cardigan Welsh Corgi - thick double-coat - who is really sensitive and hard to comb out. This helps, but still pulls enough that she is unhappy and I couldn't do as thorough a job getting her undercoat out as I'd hoped... It seems good quality, and I'll use it, but not perfect for my use?
customer_reviews.author: IMP

customer_reviews.title: Get’s through the thickest coat!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased several combs and brushes including for horses to no avail. Finally.... this rake is the one thing that could get through his coat(s)! I remove the equivalent to at least one other “animal” every time I use it (which is every day)! We have an almost 8 month old Alaskan Malamute and his shedding is brutal. I can’t help but believe that he is much more comfortable now that we are able to aid him in his coat blowing.
customer_reviews.author: HDS

customer_reviews.title: Be Very Careful
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was an undercoat rake and went to brushing. What I didn't realize was that it was actually cutting any snag out of my aussie's hair. I didn't realize how much hair it had cut out until she got up after I was done. Be very careful! It's not loose hair that keeps coming out! It is cutting their hair out!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Weidow

customer_reviews.title: Gentle... But works great and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Was bought to groom a Great Pyrenees. She was neglected and dumped on our road... Had to get her to a groomer asap..we bought this comb so while she still had short hair and will be used to a grooming process...so she won't be scared. It works wonders on my Maltipoo! And she hates to be combed... So great product .. I highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: April Chaplain

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This brush does what it claims to do. My husky/lab mix has the undercoat that needs brushing, and boy does it brush out all that extra hair. I can manage the shedding well enough with a combo of brushing her and making sure our robot vacuum runs daily. Daisy loves getting brushed and heck, I love brushing her because I don't have to spend forever and a day... well, I still have to spend a decent amount of time (there's SO MUCH HAIR). But I'm pleased with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Miller

customer_reviews.title: THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.text: We tried a lot of combs and brushes, but this is by far the BEST at pulling out the dead hair in my husky mix's undercoat. It is gentle and very efficient. The hair will bunch at the comb teeth, but slide off super easily for cleaning. We bought a Furminator for long hair dogs, and I use this brush for 98% of the brushing and then do a couple of 'finishing' strokes with the Furminator.
customer_reviews.author: nSlaypool

customer_reviews.title: For longer fur
customer_reviews.text: Great but doesn't work as well on parts of my dog that have shorter fur. Dog loves tgis one bc it doesn't hurt as much as the terminator style brush. However terminator gets at the short fur undercoat. I'll check if these types of brushes come in short fur size as well because I'd rather use this type of painless brush.
customer_reviews.author: Katya

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $$$$$ !
customer_reviews.text: The "teeth" on this rake are so short, there is no way I could effectively remove the thick undercoat on my dog as this product advertises! I have a shepard with thick long hair and this is completely useless. I am returning immediately. Dont waste your money if your dog has thick fur.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Frontiera

customer_reviews.title: It is an amazing rake. I had considered this rake and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the extra wide rake with 20 teeth for my mini aussie, ended up needing the 13 blade as it goes through the thicker coat much easier! Holy cow, i barely touched our dog and got so much undercoat from it. It is an amazing rake. I had considered this rake and the furminator, honestly I can't see how the furminator would do better, the angling of the teeth and the smoothness of it doesn't cut or scratch at all. Very great design!
customer_reviews.author: Dark Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic, I have a 100 pound lab and a 110 pound German Shepard this is the only tool I need now. I have owned every pet brush product on the planet and none of them come close to this. I threw away all my other shedding tools. This thing is awesome. I'm not even going to explain just buy it and thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Not for a husky.
customer_reviews.text: I have a husky, and that means there’s a blow out season of the undercoat twice a year. Hair is everywhere! I got this hoping it would assist, but I think it did more pulling than what was needed. He loves being brushed, but constantly got annoyed and ran away from me when I would try using it. Maybe it works better for longer coat dogs? The brush itself is very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Annah Batka

customer_reviews.title: This brush is the best I have used
customer_reviews.text: This brush is the best I have used. I have a long coated shepherd and I have used the furminator (left his coat cut and uneven) a rake brush (didn’t get even half the hair) and a regular dog brush (did nothing but slide over the top is his coat). I love how this brush makes his coat look and would recommend it to anyone who owns a dog
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S

customer_reviews.title: Must have grooming tool!
customer_reviews.text: We have two Siberian Huskies and has been using the Furminator brushes since forever. I’m not knocking the brand but this Undercoat Rake is the best investment next to quality dog food. The dogs still hate getting brushed but I have to say it is much more comfortable for them and it gets a lot more out of them per pass than anything else we’ve tried. This is a must have for any dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: BliXXXNasty

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to add to grooming kit!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE!! It does its job. I use this on my lab. Not meant for short hair and breeds without that second coat It will harm their skin. I watched a how to video to make sure I am doing it correct and I am glad I did. You are not supposed to use this as a regular brush this should only be used a couple times a week with up 4 passes or can hurt and damage skin and hair follicles. Just some information to pass along
customer_reviews.author: Jezzi

customer_reviews.title: I love the "rake"
customer_reviews.text: I love the "rake". I have a English Mastiff/Newfoundland and she has a heavy undercoat that I have found difficult to tackle. We live in the country and Xena spends much of the time outside. This year she has an abundance of cheat grass hiding in her coat, causing some discomfort.As soon as the rake arrived I began using it. I love it and Xena loves it. I have been able to remove more undercoat than ever before along with the allusive cheat grass. The rake is heavy duty and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: B Grow

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer for my Cavvie
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many brushes and combs especially for my very thick coated Cavalier King Charles Spaniel, Archie. I pulled out two grocery bags of undercoat with this thing the night I got it. And I would regularly groom him. His coat is looking fabulous, he doesn't need to be brushed as often I can do a few times a week instead of daily, less matting, and is much easier to brush. Very grateful for this product!
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo39

customer_reviews.title: Super Product and Easy to Use!  AAA+++
customer_reviews.text: We have a Wolfe and Akita hybrid with two different kinds of hair. This brush is amazing! We have tried several different brushes, but this one is by far the best! The dog doesn't seem to get tired of you brushing after 5 minutes, and pulls out all that undercoat so easily. Only thing I would change, I would love for it to be wider. I would easily recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great on cat and dog
customer_reviews.text: This well-built rake works great on our short-haired cat and our Irish wolfhound. Both enjoy the rake and it does a great job pulling the loose hairs. I love it because it's also very easy to clean. Simply rake backwards on a rag or rug and it's empty and ready to continue.
customer_reviews.author: mlitty

customer_reviews.title: MIRACLE BRUSH!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this product right now!! I know you're going to go and look for other brushes and read other reviews because you want to be sure if this is the right brush.. well it is, seriously... just buy it!! I have had my German Shepherd/Shedder for 6 fun years and have been using the furminator brush. I recently incorporated this undercoat rake and it has been a miracle worker! if I thought the furminator was a good brush, the rake is sooooo much better (step 1 rake, step 2 furminator)!! Enjoy brushing your dog, they will love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Antonieta

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC ON LONG HAIR DOGS.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first of many groom tools I purchased for my Newfoundlands that actually does it’s job and does it well of stripping their under coats without hurting the dogs. My only wish is that it came in a larger size for use on X-large dogs. Works great on all areas of dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey's mom

customer_reviews.title: Works so well for the $
customer_reviews.text: This works so well on our golden retriever! We typically use the furminator brush, but this works SO MUCH better. I was a bit skeptical to buy it, but am so glad I did. If you have a dog with a coat like a golden retriever you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A

customer_reviews.title: Best comb for thick coats
customer_reviews.text: This thing is well worth the money. We have a husky/shepherd mix who has a serious undercoat. This comb is amazing. We've been brushing her for a half hour and a whole nother dog in undercoat came off. She feels so soft and smooth now. Going to use it on the cat next.
customer_reviews.author: Karen In NC

customer_reviews.title: Must have for curly-haired Labradoodle!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Labradoodle gets terrible knots between grooming appointments, nomatter how much I brush. We love to keep her hair long which is why I'm always in search of the perfect tool. I finally found it, wow, much easier time working through knots. I am so happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sanfarinfa

customer_reviews.title: Extremely effective for long hair dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Liked it so much I ended up buying two, one with the most teeth and one with the least. Both are impressively effective at removing loose undercoat and the build quality seems to be high, no plastic, only steel and wood. If you have a long hair dog then I suggest getting the model with the least teeth, it allows you to move quicker than the models with more due to the fact that they get clogged up with hair.
customer_reviews.author: WRBarker

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase. Would purchase again. So much kinder than the other undercoat rake I've been using with nail looking prongs. this rake grabs more fur also. I have a GermanShedder and 3 fuzzy long hair cats that also love this rake. Update, Loved it so much I bought a second for the horses. Not only does the rake help with shedding, it also breaks up the mud they choose to roll in.
customer_reviews.author: slz

customer_reviews.title: Loved by me and my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My double coated dogs and I love this rake! It’s easy to use and they loved getting brushed. One actually fell asleep while I brushed him. In less than 15 minutes, I filled a bag with hair (Shiba blow out season).
customer_reviews.author: B Carter

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS THING!  Where have you been our whole lives!
customer_reviews.text: My Collie who normally hates to be brushed laid down on the floor and loved the whole experience. She shook her foot practically the entire time like she was getting a belly rub. This tool is amazing. In 10 minutes or less the job was done. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Found one that works on my golden retriever
customer_reviews.text: Yes! I've tried about 5 of these including the name brand one. This is the only one that works on my golden retriever. Wow, I get so much undercoat out. It's honestly addicting. He doesn't mind at all. I do it when he's eating breakfast and dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Vada Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Works great for dual coat dogs
customer_reviews.text: This comb works great for dual coat dogs. We have an Australian Cattle Dog and it’s great for removing his thick undercoat. I do have a question to ask the seller and/or other users: When I use this comb, my dog seems to melt like an ice cube on a Texas blacktop in July. He’s never like being groomed. But I was wondering if there’s a specific method to use or other tips to make him feel comfortable so I can use it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Walters

customer_reviews.title: This Rake is excellent and does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I have a Siberian Husky this Rake works on her better than I could have hoped and am really glad I made this purchase whenever I grab my grooming tools she immediately runs up excitedly awaiting to be brushed, combed and raked. Would definitely recommend this Rake as your furry friend would greatly appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Starr Fam

customer_reviews.title: works ok on medium coat, doesn't touch long/thick coat
customer_reviews.text: this works ok on my medium coated dogs (german shepherd, husky-mix, retriever-mix) but doesn't touch my very thick-coated husky. it just skims over the top of his undercoat. i have to go against the grain to even get it to catch hair. sadly, i bought it for him, so it's pretty useless. his coat is EXTREMELY thick, though, so if you have a dog with anything less thick than that, this should work great!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy McGinley

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this on our outdoor Great Pyrenees. As a livestock guardian, you never know what it will get into. This is the absolute best product to maintain its coat. It is surprising how much undercoat and matting you can remove with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: DadofThree

customer_reviews.title: Best deshedding tool I've used
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. It is soft to the skin but really removes the hair. My Shepherd doesn't even seem to know that she is being brushed, but it really removes the hair. This is much better than any other rake or deshedder I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Cannot say enough great things about this product
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough great things about this product. We have a plush coat GSD who loves being groomed with this tool. He sees it and runs to me for some pampering. Do follow instructions, these blades are safe when used properly. No more shedding everywhere (=
customer_reviews.author: Asttral

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: At first I was concerned the metal would be a little to aggressive, but it is amazing. I ran the brush on my arm first did not hurt or leave any sort of mark. My dog loves it and moves around for me to get the best spots lol he's an Australian cattle dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great de-matting rake! - An essential tool!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 9/19-tooth PawsPamper de-matting rake for use in my grooming salon, and it has been extremely useful on a number of different coat types! It's especially good for de-matting and de-shedding large breeds like malamutes and goldens. I highly recommend this for any dog with long hair that tends to tangle.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rake. A must have for GSD owners!
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepard and getting his undercoat out is always a nightmare. In the past I used a standard rake for brushing him and it never got all the hair out. With this tool I have gotten almost all his undercoat out which will be great for him for the hot summer months. I wish it was wider as but other than that a must have tool for any GSD owner!
customer_reviews.author: FreelanceViper

customer_reviews.title: Advantages for both long and short hair cats.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution for my cat that has the fuzzy maxi matts. It must be comfortable because my fuzzy cat lets me comb him with this, which is a major breakthrough. This comb allows for easy removal of matts. It also effectively removes loose hair. And, while I rave about the advantages for my fuzzy cat, my short hair cat absolutely loves this comb too. I believe this is because the actual portion of the comb that touchs kittys skin is smooth so its not like a some combs that are basically a line of cut wires. My cats and I highly recommend this grooming tool.
customer_reviews.author: TEG Knox

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you use like package says
customer_reviews.text: Works really well on my dog with long hair! Make sure you use like package says, small short strokes. Really grabs the under coat and pulls it out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 great pyreenes dogs with lots of fur. They need to be brushed frequently but in early summer, when they shed, all the winter coat gets matted in the longer guard hairs. This pulls it all out with little effort. Very sturdy comb.
customer_reviews.author: mamamed

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use; hugely effective; comfortable for the dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver for any dog with a substantial coat. Used properly, this tool gets down to the shedding hair and removes it painlessly, without pulling. It apparently produces a unique sensation on the skin which my dogs adapted to quite quickly. The tool is well made and comfortable in the hand. We are very pleased with this purchase and recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Katie M

customer_reviews.title: A true winner
customer_reviews.text: Bad first. Handle could be made better. Good? Everything else. No kidding. Long hair with undercoat German Shepherd is a mess on the farm. This tool easily does what they claim & handling my dog's coat is all the proof I need.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The best buy  ever!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this rake!! I have 3 rough coat St. Bernards and use a variety of grooming tools on them , but this has become my favorite. This rake is fabulous on getting the loose fur under coat during shedding season ( which is all the time ). So happy I decided to buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: It works very well.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a thick undercoat that I have always struggled with. This tool made the process so much easier. I have only done it once but expect that it is going to get better and better as I continue to work on her undercoat. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lovetoread

customer_reviews.title: Great for double coated long haired dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a long haired double coated German Shepherd. What a life saver this was! I got all of the winter undercoat from him in week, something that would take me months with other brushes I have. Even high velocity drier didn’t work as well. I love how unbreakable it is made, not those cheap plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Pole

customer_reviews.title: Epic grooming tool
customer_reviews.text: Packaging describes how to use. My 4 German shepards have thick hair and with this it makes grooming easy. It gently pulls the loose shedding hair out and massages my pups. They mean and groan like the are being pampered to a puppy spa. Tails wag legs kick. Best grooming purchase I have ever made
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Salmon

customer_reviews.title: Great brush
customer_reviews.text: I have a double coated aussie and this rake works very well. It doesn't seem to pull on her like other "brushes". My only complaint, given this is for large/medium dogs, I wish it were wider. I'm constantly having to stop to clean it out. BUT otherwise highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Flatsforlife

customer_reviews.title: Was a good price and fast shipper.
customer_reviews.text: Really great tool! Gets the undercoat out with ease, and the dogs love it. The way its made is very sturdy, and with rounded edges it doesn't hurt the dogs or scrape them. It shipped quickly and the sellers are outstanding in there concerns about being a satisfied customer. 5 STARS all the way.
customer_reviews.author: tdr

customer_reviews.title: Removes a great deal of fur without hurting!!  ♥️
customer_reviews.text: I really love this rake! I use it on my Bernedoodle which has very curly fur and it really works well. It removes a lot of fur without hurting him. Very good design and great product for removal of fur.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A. Scaricamazza

product_meta.title: PawsPamper Extra Wide Undercoat Rake for Medium to Large Dogs, Cats
feature_bullets: NO SKIN IRRITATION DEMATTING TOOL: Stainless Steel Teeth Blades with Rounded Blade Edges to Prevent Skin Irritation; Pets Actually Enjoy Being Brushed By This Rake
PREMIUM CRAFTSMANSHIP: Beautifully Crafted Shedding Brush with Wooden Handle With A Full Tang Construction;

WE DON'T BUY FAKE REVIEWS: Effectively Removes Loose, Shedding Hair Without Pulling the Coat, Especially Thick Undercoats; Helps Work Through Knots as a Great Dematting Tool; Leaving Coat Full and Healthy With the "Show Quality" Look
EXCELLENT FOR ALL BREEDS: Especially Heavy or Double Coated Dogs, Not to Use on Dogs with Thin Hair

NO QUESTIONS ASKED REFUND POLICY: You Can Request a Full Refund Anytime and It'll Be Granted. Not Only That, We'll Send You a FREE Replacement If Yours Isn't Working. Our Highest Priority is to Delight You as a Valued Customer!
